GuardOps_Library.tracing package

GuardOps_Library.tracing package#

Submodules#

GuardOps_Library.tracing.custom_processor module#

class GuardOps_Library.tracing.custom_processor.JSONProcessor(config, span_exporter: SpanExporter, max_queue_size: int | None = None, schedule_delay_millis: float | None = None, max_export_batch_size: int | None = None, export_timeout_millis: float | None = None)[source]#

Bases: BatchSpanProcessor

A BatchSpanProcessor that additionally keeps track of all the spans in an array to then export this array into the MongoDB

clean(key: str | None = None, project_id=None, user=None, playground_id=None)[source]#

A function that stores the relevant spans in MongoDB and refreshes the buffers to avoid excessive memory use. This function gets called after every span ends.

on_end(export_span)[source]#

This function gets automatically executed after every span is finished. The span is then added to the traces buffer list for MongoDB export in the clean function. Also filters out non LLM traces.

GuardOps_Library.tracing.custom_processor.process_response(response, current_span)[source]#

A function that takes the response and current span as input. Iterates recursively through the response dict and stores every key: value pair where the value is no longer a dict or list as attributes. This is needed because OpenTelemetry attributes can only be of primitive types e.g string or int but not dict.

GuardOps_Library.tracing.custom_processor.replace_dots_recursive(obj)[source]#

MongoDB canâ€™t store keys that have dots in them. This function replaces the dots with underscores.
